column1: event,"Once upon a time, in a universe somewhere between 616 and whatever the movieverse is called (199999?), Tony Stark got bored. Again. Or maybe Clint found Cap the Granada adaptation of Sherlock Holmes, and then Steve wouldn&#39
column3: Jeremy Brett is seven million times better than Basil Rathbone, and smarter too, until Tony got jealous and decided to be better than both.

column1: Obviously, he failed, but the attempt was a valiant one!

Why yes, I did buy the rights to Sherlock Holmes just to see what I look like in Victorian clothes! Well, in Steampunk clothes. Edwardian? In vests! and hats. And cravats, but we already know I know how to rock those.
And you say this Watson is a warrior and a doctor? Impressive. But the Captain will not accept this role?
...this is not going to end well for any of us, is it.
This is really not as fun as I thought it would be. And my shoes are dirty.
HI TONY! I finished with Fury early so he got someone to drop me off here. Um. That&#39
column2: s not your costume, is it? I thought this was a Victorian picture.

column1: Of course this is my costume! &nbsp
column2: And it is so Victorian. Or Edwardian. OR STEAMPUNK! You don&#39
column3: t even know what Steampunk is, Steve, how can you be expected to recognize it?

column2: s not, Tony, and it isn&#39
column3: t that coat. I think my dad had that coat. I think Bucky had that coat. And
column5: s my hat. My hat isn&#39
column6: t Victorian, Tony. In fact, if that outfit is Victorian I can be Dracula if I just...do...this.

column1: AM I DRACULA TONY? AM I? AM I THE NIGHT? AM I THE FIRE THAT MOVES THE BLOOD OF THE INNOCENT?

column2: please never say that again. um. what are we talking about? different coat! they can find me a different coat. yes.

column1: There, okay? That is at LEAST Steampunk, Steve, it&#39
column2: s definitely not from the 20s or 30s. Right? If you dad had this coat then you had a more exciting childhood than you have led us to believe, alright, and if Barnes had it I bet he stole it from an old guy, and that guy was Victorian at some point. ish. Now go do something useful, okay?
s Steve. Count Stefan von Rogerstein.

column1: ...dammit I refuse to be Tonathan Starker.
event,"Romeo and Juliet hat mir total begeistert! I am so pleased. I liked it so much. One day I will write out all the whys but now I just want to say
1. my favourite version of this evar
2. I still like Benvolio and Mercutio best
3. This country is still much too hot
4. Viennese coffee is the only kind I'll drink this happily and not just because of all the cream (rahm)
5. I had Kaiserschmarren today! It was kinda like french toast cut into diamonds but I liked it anyway.

6. I have eaten the weirdest meals today (dinner was Kaiserschmarren which is actually a dessert, then I came home and ate little wurstchens with mustard and curry sauce (the sweet german stuff) and zach said WTF and then discovered he liked them too and commandeered half, before that I had strawberry+fudge ice cream with jenny and before THAT chicken winglets and earliest of all a chinese pear.)
7. taxis are not as hard to get as they used to be
8. Lithuanian is not as pretty as I hoped it'd be but still it is very pretty."
event,"Vote for Schloss Neuschwanstein and make themy world a happier place.

PS: IF anybody wants the exposition on WHY Neuschwanstein is DEFINITELY a wonder of the world then you know please to say and I will deliver said lecture gladly and with pictures. Actually have slides even I say mad-ly."
event,"<lj-cut text=""Wikimeme sounds so endearing I couldn't not."">
Go to wikipedia and enter your birthday (but not the year). Pick three events, two births and a death for that date. [Feel smug about who you share history with.]
1610 - Galileo Galilei observes the four largest moons of Jupiter for the first time. He named them and in turn the four are called the Galilean moons.
1835 - HMS Beagle anchors off the Chonos Archipelago.
1959 - The United States recognizes the new Cuban government of Fidel Castro.
1 BC (O.S.) - Jesus of Nazareth, central figure of Christianity, date celebrated by Eastern Orthodox churches as Christmas
1925 - Gerald Durrell British naturalist, zookeeper, author, and television presenter

event,"HAPPY BIRTHDAY LATCH!
oh no, my little latchling- all grown up and pwning pretty-boys. [sobchoke]
<
event,"I have a question I should like you to answer, if you will.
Does anyone ELSE feel like 2005 was an insanely LONG year?
Seemed to me this year went on and on and on so I thought it should never end. I keep remembering things that happened YEARS ago and then realising they were in February or May.
So now it's 2006, and I find myself wondering- does anyone ELSE feel like this?"
event,"I quite like my slave-deal-job! by which I mean, it's really very amusing."
event,"only with clothes on. All I really meant to comment on was the gleeful laying-about

coughjennyhackcough everywhere, I don't know where the nudists come in. Even the Darths C are taking time off today, apparently- the one dispenses advice about the merits of romancing boring people for money while the other skips class entirely just because it's possible.
English Class Topic = Science and Technology. I foresee lessons even more hopeless than the ethnocentricm ones, oh joy. Math = still differentiation + failed test + teacher cross with me, triple joy.

On the other hand we ARE getting closer to the IR in history and that will be pleasing indeed. Why am I talking about this? Because the things that occupy my somewhatmessedupmind at the moment are so hopeless they aren't even worth discussing. Having said which, they seem to spill out in strange situations. Tus far: over eggplant in that Anatolia restaurant with MD and Sabr[iii]ina or dashing down a corridor before assembly or in between [studying the processes of] purifying metals and plating objects in Choa Chu Kang. This is getting ridiculous, not to mention PAINFUL, so there is not much to say except I hope it ENDS soon. Or moderately soon, because the only thing I will be more horrified by than feeling like this is not feeling like this which seems like exactly the sort of teenage thing I am always afraid I will find myself thinking so THERE YOU GO I QUIT YOU WIN I DON'T KNOW ANYTHING ANYMORE someone shoot me and be done with it.

Also I hate performance tasks especially in math with supercillious math teachers imPLYing things annoyingly about talks and the usefulness thereof. Too many people forcing my hand in too many directions even withOUT being pressured into talks about one-way-street problems, whatever those may be.
I adore Static, and the new[ish/er] season of X-Men: Evolution is fairlypleasing though I STILL OBJECT TO KURT'S TERRIBLE ACCENT and Forge looked sortadodgy.
Brilliant the only things I have to be happy about are mutant teenagers.
event,"So Kahn's thumb remains dead and Rense plays again.

Only not really because the Incredible Perfection of Being that is the reserve is eating my soul with thoughts of future angst and future envy to such an extent I can hardly think about football without getting sort of grumpy anymore. Which is NOT good because I think about the gerlings um well ALL THE TIME.

In other news the gods-cursed exams are OVER so I am free to memorise Egyptian gods and Roman emperors and TIDY MY ROOM THANK GOODNESS and other placid ordinary things like that. Also COUNT HOURS TO STAR WARS EPISODE III because I can feel my pulse rising already. The Art Shop which is so pleasing our mate Elsie of the Japanese Chicken makes me thrilled also, especially the canvas paper I cannot afford. Have decided to learn to draw in proportion first, anyway.
Rain makes me affectionate, this I know.

My mother likes her [GERMAN] mug, it is a THOROUGHLY pleasing black coffee mug that comes with chalk on which you write messages like I LOVE YOU and GOOD MORNING and I AM GOING TO KILL MYSELF BECAUSE MICHAEL RENSING WILL NEVER MARRY ME. I think I am going to use up our chalk quite quickly."
event,"I'm sure it'll do SOME good, she says.
WHAT GOOD EVER COMES OF THIS?
Ah well, at least I'll be able to say I tried. And the strangest people will know why.
AND TOMORROW THE FORSAKEN EXAMS WILL BE OVER THANK HEAVENS.
I am going to fail math AND chem.
event,"Especially when the Irishman in question is my Steerpike, I hiss cobra-like.
In between math worksheets, what a body wants is information such as Kahn has killed his thumb,so Rense plays tonight.

NOT that Jonathan Rhys-Meyers, who may be gorgeous in an evil [and therefore highly desirable] way but is certainly NOT REMOTELY connected to GRACELAND, has finished filming Elvis, the mini-series for CBS that I can't figure out whether I am desperate to see or definitely never going near. Because I think the accent will make me cry but I would readily suffer than for JRM in shiny suits [coughVELVETGOLDMINEcough].

Yeah okay so exams make my brain go soft, talk to me next week and I will TOTALLY deny any connection between these two separate notes, but I am slightly alarmed at the prospect of developing an affinity for young men with long fringes and shiny/colour-blind outfits.
<lj-cut text= ""Thank you Teddy for aNOTHER reason to put off electrolysis for another minute."">

column1: mother returning from india = potential catastrophe
RS cutting hair = hair in danger of DISAPPEARING

event,"I do, very much. It's almost weird to have enough time to do something I haven't done in years with someone I haven't talked to properly in what certainly FEELS like too long[reproach reproach].

Math is over, as usual I will fail and it's my fault but once again I find I do not care nearly as much as I should. We will work on this eventually, first we must go back to preventing an even worse catastrophe from occurring by the end of next week.Malay is odd, we are doing debate motions all the time. Today we had a three-way debate in which everyone was opp, which was pretty funny because we were rebutting each other's points and then developing them as substantive. and this is in a class of six
column2: the class upstairs did it with about twelve groups. Entella is being nice to me again, it's a funny funny thing. Not that I'm not grateful for it, I just don't always know what I did exactly. SS tomorrow is going to be good, I think
column3: the only teacher who tells me what I want to know if I ask [and take the time to sift through all that evasion for the answer I'm looking for]. Assembly will be as usual buy what more do we ever expect? No change if no one asks for it, and all that. Finally a vaguely interesting English assignment, and of course we'll spend about fifteen minutes on it in class when it happens.

column1: It's not funny how busy we are doing nothing.

Having said that this randomtraipse has done a GREAT great deal in the way of replenishing vibes and equipping me with Lasting skills, and tomorrow I shall cement this over the empty math block. Happy. [Otherhalf I do not think it can be a good thing that I have a Padawan to think of and yet I get maybe a third of my energy from an almostmindlink with a Sithling.] So thank you for that, and see you tomorrow. I really am very very glad I haven't lost ALL my spontaneity because then I really would be becoming <s>one of them</s> a -debater at heart-, and you know I have higher ambitions than that."
<s>Mark</s>Nic has got <s>his</s>her work [Nic's in love with her work] Nic HIDES in her work [from what!] from facing her failure. Detach from feeling alive [the one of us to survive.]
I should tell you I should tell you [you can see it in my eyes.]"
event,"why do my best friends sound more like a zoo than anything else?]
event,"Liverpuddle beat my Schneider's team[<--3-1 Leverkusen]!
Those royal fools at Madrid sort of beat the Italian models of perfection!{<--1-0 Juve]
Indignance, annoyance and general crossness abound.

Here is the only really important and decidedly GOOD news. I swear this fixes migraines much more effectively than Zomitriptan and all those odd things. They are so wonderful, I say staunchly, and so considerate too. Scoring in the FIRST FIVE MINUTES so I could actually see it live and lucid before I started to fall asleep on my feet [in the dark-and-silent so parents wouldn't figure me out], how polite is that. My defence makes me happy, oh yes. Captain Kahn unfortunately remains uninjured and able-to-play, but at least he appears to have won the Goalkeeper Challenge the German press has been jumping about over. [And may I just say, he has won this unilaterally because our friend Hans-Jorg deserves to be SHOT. Three puddle goals will NOT do, oh no.]

Anyway, yes, nice margin for a home game, for the next go we just keep it contained and maybe unleash machine-gun Makaay on them at suitable intervals. So much for Arsenal being an Earth-shattering force, huh.

In unrelated happynews, Sammy Kuffour's second son is going to be born in May, which as you know is an excellent month to be born in. Also an excellent family, especially after poor beautiful Godiva, and an excellent country [I say predictably]. So yes, a happy baby will soon be had, may he be named Michael, Tristan or Alex.
[Elizabunny I told you what would happen if we won this and I think I must be right. Hasta siempre, onwards to victory and all that.]"
event,"I am most annoyed with [um, well] the water cycle.

This is not good for health in general. I mean, LOOK at it. The goalkeeper boy [the youngbeatiful one not the crunchy one in that picture] had better not be prone to coughs and colds and suchlike [like Michael Ballack is, I mean].
<s>Anyway, that is my excuse for thescorelinewearenottalkingabout.</s>
OBVIOUSLY CERTAIN GOALKEEPERS NEED A DAY OUT SINCE CERTAIN OTHER GOALKEEPERS ARE <S>USELESS</S> GETTING SLEEPY.
I love my new-and-shiny RENT album, I say for the twenty-second time."
event,"you do wonders. i find hope and grace in You alone. says:
Nic. [He is] the light to brighten your darkest hour. says:
Nic. [He is] the light to brighten your darkest hour. says:
you do wonders. i find hope and grace in You alone. says:
And that is all there is to it, you know.
Drowning in delight I don't deserve, which will wither within a week or so but WHAT IS WITH THIS ALLITERATION I AM NOT DOING IT INTENTIONALLY I SWEAR.
Oh heavens alive and pharoahs in valleys I feel like a fool.
No, I swear, I have not found cheap-going marijuana."

event,"but I have to do that in our lit journal assignment anyway so it's okay. Over and above this, of course, is that I am completely aware of the fact that there are some things I am too young and foolish to do justice to. So I'm just going to stay quiet on this until I have the wit and wisdom to do it properly.
For the record I do think about it, though.

This is how I've been feeling recently, odd things have been happening since early this week to show me what I should be doing, and where and why and how. [No, I'm not trying to get to Munich tomorrow for the Bayer04 rematch.] Suffice to say I don't like changing paradigms, but also that I really like our SS teacher for all his pronouncements can be a bit odd from time to time. [I still contend that the wool trade, whether industrial or not, is just plain EVIL because of the detriment it brought to Irish Catholics and their poor spiked children, so THERE Herr SSMann.] Sorry coolamanda for involving you in that. Inherently cool thing about Herr SSmann is really that he requires interpretation, you know? I quite like this Figure!it!out! thing.
Not so much the rebels we look like, hey."
I love it I love it I love it don't you love it too?

RENT is the best thing that has happened to me in a very long time. I have no idea who this man is but I love him, he is Radames and Electra [STARTLIGHT EXPRESS TRAIN not Elektra DD girlfriend] in equal parts and his voice makes me happy and he is more angstful than anyone ever, so.

edit: YOU KNOW WHY HE IS RADAMES AND ELECTRA? BECAUSE BOTH HAVE PLAYED HIM. This recording of course STARS <S>MY</s>the lovely ADAM [Pascal] but John Partridge plays him in the Original German Cast which, obviously, is next on the To Acquire list.
I like her too, even though her name is Mimi.
And no, I am not identifying Michael22 with this main character. Fact that he has AIDS might be something to do with it, then again might not.
Anyway the point is I am surviving math and litjournal and rubbish with RENT and I am suitably grateful.
Biology lessons get more amusing every day, though I sort of miss the Mothership and the synchronised swimming. I tell you that sort of sight will never happen again in any one person's lifetime.
event,"1. It is not necessary to assume that every European gentleman between 17 and 23 years of age is in some way an incarnation of that kid you like.

2. It is not even vaguely accurate to assume that anyone in the world [except the Otherhalf, your twin and other people on whom you force this information] will ever connect said European youths with that kid you like.

3. It is therefore not a forgone conclusion that you should form a deep emotional attachment to every lad on stage or screen whose fringe falls a certain way or whose collar looks particularly like so or whose voice sounds like you think it should.
4. This practice in fact should be immediately abandoned as all it does is make you unduly upset when the young gentlemen you have identified invariably get shot in the head within fifteen minutes.
Yegods I am never going to watch TV again."
event,"Asked what's different since his return from Marseilles, Bixente Lizarazu aka Liza SAYS:
""Nothing has changed. Oliver Kahn gets mad whenever he lets one in, and Sammy Kuffour's going around kicking everyone.""
I love them, I love them SO much.
They almost but not really cure headaches.
I hope Oliver doesn't get mad AT MICHAEL and I hope Sammy kicks everyone EXCEPT MICHAEL. Yes.
I hope Miss Yeo doesn't get mad at and kick ME regarding RS. Mingmingming, please tell her Nazis only eat white meat, and probably BLONDE, BLUE-EYED white meat too.
event,"Am muchly proud of myself about this, but mostly sort of disbelieving and/or grateful.

I think I am Happy again now, or peaceful at least. It would have been incredibly depressing if not impossible to face a whole year of Being a Senior without any of the really lovely teachers [save the orals lady and perhaps the somewhat uncomforting Darth C. [Yeah, so I'm just complaining AGAIN about life without ProfX2 and the RS]. It occurs to me that now we have re-established contact [thankye otherhalf] I might be less fond of Entella than I have been this week.
No, even I can stick to a new year's resolution for more than a week.
Muchly I hope no one from our best-beloved institution comes across this list
column2: we will be in way over our heads if the good ladies decide to dissect that paragraph to see who is who. [The orals lady naturally will find herself immediately and work from there, in no time at all we will be found out AND ALL WILL BE LOSSSST.]

column1: I could talk about the debbies but it would make at least two of us depressed so that will come tonight or another day.

RS News: Sie ist leider healthy, happy and quite bouncy. Apparently she misses her students a bit [COULD ANYONE BLAME HER] but has been telling the RussianRevolution stories anyway [A-nas-ta-sia say I] to good effect. Sie war nicht in Sri Lanka but in India, which JUSTIFIES MY CONCERN and proves that when I say AYII MY FOOTBALLERS AYII THE RS I am usually not far off the mark since both turned up in the general region.
<lj-cut text=""If meine Anderehalf, The-Mae, Mingming, Mother-Di or Twinette should be interested in getting stuck in also, I should be DELIGHTED to have company in this new mad scheme."">
This is A Plan of Strangeness and ChineseNewYeardom.

I have always thought it must be fun for teachers to get visitors at Chinese New Year. I have, however, neither any teachers [left at RGPS] nor any ChineseNewYearness so have never contributed to this myself.

I am thinking, if we are neither overworked nor otherwise committed, we should go THERE instead and say YO RS HAPPY UM JANUARY because she will have no visitors [since secondary schools don't GET those] and probably no particularly friendly students [yet]. I am thinking, it would be quiiite fun to pay a random student to say [RS] You GOTTA come out I need to talk to you about ESSAYS and be waiting there, beamingly.
I don't know what their arrangement IS, I don't know whether it's ALLOWED and I certainly don't know whether she won't cut and run as soon as she can manage it.
Is this worth attempting? I kind of think it might be fun[/ny] if it isn't disastrous."
event,"going to see the team I love for the boy who isn't there.

column1: Having said that: GRRRRARRRRRRRRR I HATE THIS STUPID COMPUTER FUSS MOAN."
event,"THIS JOURNAL ISN'T DEAD, I SWEAR IT ISN'T.
's just, I keep feeling incredibly stupid and having nothing to say that could interest you.

We are going to Hong Kong on Wednesday. ANDEREHALF IS THAT NOT STUPID YOU FINALLY COME BACK FROM TAIWAN AND I STILL CAN'T TALK TO YOU BECAUSE I'M IN HONG KONG WAIL. Am reading Tomorrow Never Dies, ostensibly to get into the spirit of Hong Kong but just because I tend to relish chances to indulge in one of my stranger secret weaknesses [James Bond, I mean, not hongkong]. I do love the one-liners when I'm in that frame of mind- and some are actually directly applicable. Trouble is, like with Holmes' witticisms, nothing is quite as satisfying as it should be when no one RECOGNISES perfect quotes. This would not be a problem if I read <s>over-hypedsorrykayellutterlydullsorrykayellfairlystupidsorrykayell</s> normal things like LOTR, but you know I never will, so.

Have survived a somewhat harrying Interview With a Vice-Principal as demanded by my manic mother [henceforth 3M] by virtue of memorising half the GERMAN TEXT OF AIDA since I NOW OWN THE ORIGINAL ESSEN CAST RECORDING. Presently I am in love with Mathias Edenborn, in awe of Florence Kasumba and delighted by Joel Karie. It is pretty much impossible to explain WHY everything is more wonderful in German, but it IS. At the moment I really, REALLY wish I had more African hair. I mean, this stuff is FLAT, and it doesn't MOVE except when it waves limply, and it absolutely cannot be braided. Not that cornrows are encouraged in the Raffles schools. Back to which, Frau CCF seemed very good-natured and happy-like about everything, did not scold me as I expected or fully take the side of the 3M. Details are available but not strictly exciting, so.

Teddy has something called a DS- which does not stand for Deutsche Superstar [Elli], whom I was going to vote for when Taufik got Singapore into World Idol, only now there might not BE a World Idol so the 100 STOP SLY votes I begged, bothered and DRAGGED out of people may have been perhaps not as useful as I would have hoped- and it is making him strangely happy. Eli has DS too, only hers is more DEBATE STRESS than DUAL-SYSTEM because the 3M is being IMPOSSIBLE with training and such. Venue not a problem anymore since I have discovered a Clever! way to comb my hair to hide the bits that aren't supposed to be there.

In the absence of my Otherhalf I have been reading Random things to supplement my now-quite-substantial understanding of Marvel families. I now know a bit about the FF [like The Human Torch SO much] and quite a lot about Wolverine, as well as more about The Avengers [still think Thor is loverly but like Quicksilver too now, do NOT like The Vision]. This makes me feel quite clever but, of course, annoys the 3M to death- which hardly makes for contributions to a Happy, Peaceful Home Environment.
And that, ladies and gentlemen, has been a summary of how NOTHING EVER HAPPENS TO ME worth reporting, and as such a justification of LONG PERIODS OF NOT-THERE-NESS. Yes.
[ACH, UNSINN! (NUR DIE FANTASIE HAT UNS VERFUEHRT.) Oh I do love him.]"
event,"I am going to KEEL over and DIE soon [perhaps in TWENTY-TWO DAYS oh help help but probably sooner].

<lj-cut text=""I keep TELLING you, it's just football."">1. I don't see how anyone can play two [okay, one and a half] league games in four-and-twenty hours and not be quite, how you say, knackered beyond belief.
2. or how said [supposed] adult can sulk because he didn't have pretty clean sheets. I say, when your team scores four goals you shuttupandenjoyit. Apparently that's not how it works.
3. I WANT MATCHDAY SIX RIGHT NOW. [by which I mean, before Herr Kahn gets un-injured.
Okay, not just football- Mamma Mia too.
1. It was fun. Very much fun, yes.
2. I was glad to go, had much fun with unexpected company.
3. The plot was a bit hopeless, oh yes. But watching it I kind of decided that
4. ABBA songs are just naturally brilliant of lyrick so really
5. Anyone's life could be an ABBA musical
6. kind of like Elton John's music
7. or a combination of both with some random modern opera mixed in.
8. One day I'll get the songs in order to prove it.
9. I want chronic silver platform boots!
Now to re-cut [un-cut] my hair. This is great, it is actually honestly going to come out longer. I beam."
event,"My angels are the most delightful creatures, I feel sort of cleansed by this mystical experience. I WISH THE FOOL ENGLISHMEN AT ESPN WOULD REALISE OUR GAMES DESERVE BROADCAST. Glowergrowl.
Still, I like this result and they are suitably grateful at least.
Happy happy happy. At least NOW we get some time on air.
All is well indeed in the Venice of the North.

[I don't like this title, maybe because they are in the SOUTH [though North of Venice] also they are way cooler than Venice, also Michaels Rensing AND Ballack play there so they should at LEAST be Rome.]"
event,"No time no time no time.

Am returned from Kranji Commonwealth War Memorial where as expected British, Australian and New Zealander veterans stood and were sad. My dad being my dad noticed immediately that the British High Commisioner's car is German while the Australian's is Japanese, but I guess we can live with that. Ceremony was lovely, the HC very nearly caused tears with his war poems [Little Boy Lost especially].
There are an awful lot of Michaels out there.

With no disrespect or ill will intended at all, I must say here that I hope Oliver Kahn, Fredi Rost, Timo Hildebrand and Jens Lehmann are all either very busy or slightly injured for the period of 15-24 December.
event,"My reserves are through to their quarter-finals! 3-2 so I can't say YOU SEE THIS IS ENTIRELY GOOD GOALKEEPING but, I mean, <s>he</s>that's what got them THIS far, right?
If FC Bayern play FC Bayern Am. at the semi-final I think I'm going to cry.
Completely Irrelevant Additional Note: IT STARTED SNOWING TODAY. THE TENTH OF NOVEMBER IS TOO EARLY FOR SNOW."
event,"ZJ: Hey cool your guys are from Munich!
ZJ: I bet your goalkeeper has seen them!
NJ: I bet he took Melanie to see them.
NJ: Nothing nothing sorry yeah he probably has.
ZJ: YOU WANNA PLAY FIFA 2005 I WILL SHOW YOU HOW TO TRAIN YOUR GUY?
NJ: Nein danke, even German Goalkeepers cannot induce me to touch your console games.
ZJ: Eeeerrrrggghhh fiiine. I think LFC wants to buy Michael Ballack...
NJ: FINE FINE FINE OKAY aachh."
event,"A new form of military torture has been devised.
Harder to deal with than a knife wound that never stops bleeding.
Scarier than whiplash AND concussion at the same TIME.
More terrifying than a three day Madonna music-video-marathon.
You, too could be forced to watch WHITE CHICKS with your WHOLE FAMILY.

I come online. I stop, I stare, I start laughing

event,"I do like these Random German Things I find.
Ich denke, that my Twin liked it muchly also.
She got my programme signed by A Gorgeous Franz, who incidentally looks rather like Francesco Totti gone blonde. Lovelovelove.

Not quite as beautiful as my Rense but fairly lovely. Not as charming either, looked UTTERLY BORED while waiting to go home, not remotely enthusiastic about signing things the way Happy!Bouncing,Bounding! Wolfram was. Himself very sweet but less shocking in terms of Perfect Male Beauty quotient. To all the darlings who wormed and squirmed out of this concert, yo, I say I will not bear grudges but HA, please to note that you missed a Deeply Happy-Making Situation.

Kayell I am Very Glad you didn't come because I fully did my screamshriekhopskipBOUNCE thing, to such extent that Jemina had to do the talking cos I woulda forgotten my name and ended up with things addressed to Umnick or Na-er-ne-NICola or Francesco or Michael.
So yes, two in the morning and I have German class at ten tomorrow.
On the other hand exams are over, only three subjects are spectacular failures and I WILL NEVER HAVE TO READ MACBETH AGAIN."
Protestants occupying fertile Catholic land are evil.
The Law is evil because it is fundamentally not correct.
